title: Alexa App Compatibility
custom_preconds: Note: The Alexa app should automatically download to Alexa-enabled Fire tablets. If your Fire tablet is not an Alexa-enabled device, it won't support Alexa interactions even if the Alexa app is downloaded to the device.
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has any of the following:

Devices:
- Fire OS 3.0 or higher
- Android 4.4 or higher
- iOS 8.0 or higher
OR 
Browsers on your Wi-Fi enabled computer:
- Safari
- Chrome
- Firefox
- Microsoft Edge
- Internet Explorer (10 or higher)
custom_expected: THEN the user is able to download/install the Amazon Alexa app

title: Alexa App Setup
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user navigates to their mobile device's app store (Apple App Store, Google Play, or Amazon Appstore) and searches for "Alexa app"
OR navigates on their browser to ( https://alexa.amazon.com )
AND 
the Echo device is turned on
custom_steps: WHEN the user downloads the app for the first time
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to the Alexa app setup process
AND goes through the setup flow

(Set device Wi-Fi to: Amazon-1LU. Then when Alexa states user is connected, user is then prompted in the app to select a Wi-Fi.  Select the office Wi-Fi.)

title: Alexa App Homepage
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has started the Alexa app setup process
custom_steps: WHEN the user has completed the Alexa app setup process
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to the Alexa app Home page

title: Add Skill
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND is on the Home page
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on Skills
AND conducts a search for or invokes Alexa to enable the following skill: i.e. 'Enable MLB'
custom_expected: THEN the user is able to view the skill and select it from the app: MLB.com Gameday Audio

title: Open MLB Skill w/o Enabling It
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is logged onto the Alexa app
AND completed the Setup process
AND has not added the MLB.com Gameday Audio Skill
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on Skills
AND conducts a search for or invokes Alexa to enable the MLB.com Gameday Audio skill: 
- 'Alexa, open MLB'
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
This skill is not enabled. To enable it..
OR
If you've already enabled MLB, say" 'Open MLB.' Otherwise, first say, 'Enable MLB skill.'

title: Enable Skill
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on 'Enable' button on the app or invokes Alexa to enable the MLB skill
custom_expected: THEN the 'Enable' button is replaced by the 'Disable Skill' button in the app

title: Enabling Gameday Audio Skill via Amazon Website (Desktop Version)
custom_preconds:
Given user is on the desktop
Log into Amazon.com with your valid credentials
custom_steps:
Navigate to the following URL on your desktop:
https://www.amazon.com/MLB-Advanced-Media-L-P-MLB-com/dp/B01M09Z8F2
custom_expected:
THEN the user should be able to enable the skill via the desktop
AND then log into the app with the skill already enabled

title: Link Account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the first time user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND is on the skills page
AND has added and enabled the skill: MLB.com Gameday Audio
custom_steps: WHEN the user speaks the intent: 'Alexa Tell M.L.B. to link my account'
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"To use the MLB skill, you'll first need to link your M.L.B.com account. You must have a subscription to At Bat premium or MLB.tv Premium. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started."

title: Link Account via App
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the first time user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND is on the Alexa app's skill page
AND has added and enabled the skill: MLB.com Gameday Audio
AND the user speaks the intent: 'Alexa tell M.L.B. to link my account'
AND Alexa responds with:
"To use the MLB skill, you'll first need to link your M.L.B.com account. You must have a subscription to At Bat premium or MLB.tv Premium. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started."
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps the linking card in the Alexa app
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to the MLB.com Login / Registration form where the user can either login or register for a new account

title: MLB.com Forgot Password
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the first time user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND is on the Alexa app's skill page
AND has added and enabled the skill: MLB.com Gameday Audio
AND the user speaks the intent: 'Tell M.L.B. to link my account'
AND the user taps the linking card in Alexa app
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the 'Forgot Password' link on the Login/Registration page
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to the MLB.com forgot password form where the user enters their email and submits

title: Forgot Password E-mail
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the MLB.com forgot password page
AND the user has a valid MLB.com account
AND has entered their email and submitted
custom_steps: WHEN the user checks their e-mail
custom_expected:
THEN the user should receive a new password
AND be able to log in/link account with the new password

title: MLB.com Login Credentials with NO At Bat Subscription/NO Gameday Audio
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the first time user is on the Alexa app's skill page
AND has added and enabled the skill: MLB.com Gameday Audio
AND the user speaks the intent: 'Tell M.L.B. to link my account'
AND the user taps the linking card in Alexa app
AND the user is on the MLB.com login/registration form
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters their login credentials for the following account type: 
MLB.com with NO At Bat Premium/NO gameday audio
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to the At Bat web purchase flow

title: MLB.com Login Credentials w/At Bat Subscription & Gameday Audio
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the first time user is on the Alexa app's skill page
AND has added and enabled the skill: MLB.com Gameday Audio
AND the user speaks the intent: 'Tell M.L.B. to link my account'
AND the user taps the linking card in Alexa app
AND the user is on the MLB.com login/registration form
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters their login credentials for the following account type:
MLB.com At Bat Premium paid subscriber
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to an amazon confirmation page stating the skill was successfully link
AND when the user returns to the Alexa app Skill's page the 'Link Account' is replaced with 'Disable skill to unlink account'

title: EDIT_Register New Account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the first time user is on the Alexa app's skill page
AND has added and enabled the skill: MLB.com Gameday Audio
AND the user speaks the intent: 'Tell M.L.B. to link my account'
AND the user taps the linking card in Alexa app
AND the user is on the MLB.com login/registration form
custom_steps:
WHEN the user fills out the required fields for Registration
User can register with an e-mail address and zip code, then view confirmation of account linking in Alexa app.  (Alt: may require user to log in again using the mobile form.)
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to a 

Android only?
Alexa Users Next Steps page which prompts user to Subscribe to At Bat Premium

MLB.com Gameday Audio page with instructions on:
- how to sign up for At Bat premium (To use the MLB skill on your Alexa, you'll need to be an At Bat Premium paid subscriber.)
AND 
- how to complete the Alexa app setup process

title: Subscribe to At Bat Premium Purchase Webivew
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the first time user is on the Alexa app's skill page
AND has added and enabled the skill: MLB.com Gameday Audio
AND the user speaks the intent: 'Tell M.L.B. to link my account'
AND the user taps the linking card in Alexa app
AND the user is on the MLB.com login/registration form
AND user has registered for a new MLB.com account
AND user is on the Purchase page 'MLB.com Gameday Audio Alexa Users Next Steps, You're almost done!' page
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the 'Subscribe to At Bat Premium' link
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to the At Bat purchase flow webview

title: At Bat Premium Purchase Confirmation
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the At Bat purchase page
custom_steps: WHEN the user has completed the At Bat purchase flow
custom_expected:
THEN the user will view confirmation of account linking in Alexa app.  
(Alt: may require user to log in again using the mobile form.)

title: Purchasing using IAP_At Bat App installed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is launching the app for the first time OR speaks the intent: Tell M.L.B. to link my account
AND the user taps on the linking card in Alexa app
AND logs in using mlb.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN At Bat is installed
AND the user taps on either of the following links (test both):
- open in iTunes
- open in Android Play Store
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to At Bat app, where they can purchase in-app

title: Purchasing using IAP_At Bat App Not installed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is launching the app for the first time OR speaks the intent: Tell M.L.B. to link my account
AND the user taps on the linking card in Alexa app
AND logs in using mlb.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN At Bat is NOT installed
AND the user taps on either of the following links (test both):
- open in iTunes
- open in Android Play Store
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to user is taken to applicable app store, where they can download and purchase in-app

title: Purchasing using IAP from Desktop
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is launching the app for the first time OR speaks the intent: Tell M.L.B. to link my account
AND the user taps on the linking card in Alexa app
AND logs in using mlb.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN user is on a desktop, user can view At Bat app in:
- Web Amazon
- Google Play Store 
- iTunes
custom_expected:
THEN the user is able to download At Bat
AND then purchase on their device

GIVEN the user is launching the app for the first time OR speaks the intent: Tell M.L.B. to link my account

AND logs in using mlb.com account

*To use the MLB skill on your Alexa, you'll need to be an At Bat Premium paid subscriber

AND purchases subscription
